name: Adaptateur de l'API des r√©ponses OpenAI pour les flux de travail LLM et Agent IA

user.name: Jimleuk
user.bio:
Freelance AI Automation Engineer based in London, UK. Since 2024, my n8n templates have documented my journey into applied AI and have helped hundreds of businesses and organisations get up to speed with AI automation. Today, I continue to explore use-cases as AI evolves and occasionally upload templates which I find novel and interesting.

Subscribe to the RSS Feed: https://cdn.subworkflow.ai/n8n-templates/rss.xml

description:
### Ce mod√®le n8n d√©montre comment utiliser l'API des r√©ponses d'OpenAI avec les n≈ìuds LLM et Agent IA existants.

Bien que je recommande d'attendre le support officiel, si vous √™tes impatient et souhaitez une mani√®re d√©tourn√©e d'int√©grer l'API des r√©ponses d'OpenAI dans vos flux de travail IA existants, ce mod√®le est s√ªr de satisfaire !

Cette approche impl√©mente un simple wrapper API pour l'API des r√©ponses en utilisant les webhooks int√©gr√©s de n8n. Lorsque l'URL de base est point√©e vers ces webhooks en utilisant un identifiant OpenAI personnalis√©, il est possible d'intercepter la requ√™te et de la remapper pour la compatibilit√©.

### Comment √ßa fonctionne
* Un sous-n≈ìud OpenAI est attach√© √† notre agent mais a un identifiant personnalis√© sp√©cial o√π l'url de base est chang√©e pour pointer vers les webhooks de ce mod√®le.
* Lors de l'ex√©cution d'une requ√™te, la demande de l'agent est transmise √† notre mini flux de travail de compl√©tion de chat.
* Ici, nous prenons la requ√™te par d√©faut et remappons les valeurs √† utiliser avec un n≈ìud HTTP qui est configur√© pour interroger l'API des r√©ponses.
* Une fois qu'une r√©ponse est re√ßue, nous devrons remapper la sortie pour la compatibilit√© avec Langchain. Cela signifie simplement que le n≈ìud LLM ou Agent peut l'analyser et r√©pondre √† l'utilisateur.
* Il existe deux formats de r√©ponse, un pour le streaming et un pour les r√©ponses non-streaming.

### Comment utiliser
* Vous devez activer ce flux de travail pour pouvoir utiliser les webhooks.
* Cr√©ez l'identifiant OpenAI personnalis√© comme indiqu√©.
* Allez dans vos flux de travail IA existants et remplacez le n≈ìud LLM par l'identifiant OpenAI personnalis√©. Vous n'avez pas besoin de copier quoi que ce soit d'autre dans le mod√®le existant.

### Exigences
* Compte OpenAI pour l'API des r√©ponses

### Personnalisation de ce flux de travail
* N'h√©sitez pas √† exp√©rimenter avec d'autres LLM en utilisant cette m√™me technique !
* Restez √† jour avec les annonces de l'API des r√©ponses et apportez des modifications si n√©cessaire.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

defaults.name: Lorsque le message de chat est re√ßu

parameters.content:
## 1. Create a New Custom OpenAI Credential
[Learn more about OpenAI Credentials](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/openai/)

To use Github Models with our existing n8n nodes, one approach is to mimic an openAI compatible API connected through the OpenAI model subnode. Sounds complicated but don't worry, this template shows you how! The first step is to setup a new OpenAI credential so that we can change the Base URL.

### LLM Models via N8N Webhooks
1. Create a new OpenAI Credential and call it "n8n-responses-api"
2. Enter API key as anything you like eg. "12345"
3. Enter Base URL as "https://<your_n8n_url>/webhook/n8n-reponses-api"
4. Activate your workflow! This only really works with the production webhook URL.


Feel free to change the names to whatever you want, just make sure the LLM node is able to reach it!

## 2. Listing All Available Models 
[Read more about the Webhook Trigger node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.webhook/)

Our first endpoint is for listing all models. The Github Models API how we can do this but the response requires some re-mapping to make it compatible with our LLM node.

## 3. Remap OpenAI Responses API for Langchain Compatibility
[Learn more about the HTTP request node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.httprequest)

OpenAI's Responses API is a massive upgrade in terms of capability and support for multimodal use-cases. Unfortunately, this means
the API responses are now so fundamentally different, it's not that quite straightforward to use them with Langchain.
Here, we show it's possible to map the output for compatibility but does so loses out on newer features of the API.

## Try It Out!
### This n8n template demonstrates how to use OpenAI's Responses API with existing LLM and AI Agent nodes.

Though I would recommend just waiting for official support, if you're impatient and would like a round-about way to integrate OpenAI's responses API into your existing AI workflows then this template is sure to satisfy!

This approach implements a simple API wrapper for the Responses API using n8n's builtin webhooks. When the base url is pointed to these webhooks using a custom OpenAI credential, it's possible to intercept the request and remap for compatibility.

### How it works
* An OpenAI subnode is attached to our agent but has a special custom credential where the base_url is changed to point at this template's webhooks.
* When executing a query, the agent's request is forwarded to our mini chat completion workflow.
* Here, we take the default request and remap the values to use with a HTTP node which is set to query the Responses API.
* Once a response is received, we'll need to remap the output for Langchain compatibility. This just means the LLM or Agent node can parse it and respond to the user.
* There are two response formats, one for streaming and one for non-streaming responses.

### How to use
* You must activate this workflow to be able to use the webhooks.
* Create the custom OpenAI credential as instructed.
* Go to your existing AI workflows and replace the LLM node with the custom OpenAI credential. You do not need to copy anything else over to the existing template.

### Requirements
* OpenAI account for Responses API

### Customising this workflow
* Feel free to experiment with other LLMs using this same technique!
* Keep up to date with the Responses API announcements and make modifications as required.

### Need Help?
Join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d) or ask in the [Forum](https://community.n8n.io/)!

Happy Hacking!
